paper_abstract: Resilience to nonstationarity and deep uncertainty is a prerequisite for decadal to century scale water security. Adaptation is urgent at decadal ("near-term") horizons, when projections of stressors and vulnerability are typically more reliable but climate internal variability may preclude actionable insights. A case study of at-risk power production suggests that informed decisions are still possible.
paper_title: Climate Adaptation Informatics: Water Stress on Power Production
